title: Issues starting client + logging in
body:
Hi all, 
Ever since early last week, I've been having trouble logging in and starting the client. 
I've been getting the "RADS error" and I've tried all fixes as outlined by this Reddit post //[link](http://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/1lps3z/if_client_is_not_starting_heres_the_fix_enjoy/)// 
The fixes seem to either work for day, or flat out not work, even when the "fixes" do work, I either have trouble logging in or get constantly dropped during que/in-game.
My ISP is TPG and I'm located in Sydney,etc.etc. 

I haven't been able to play League at all for the past week or so and it's been painful... halp.


I swear TPG is equivalent to this little bastard in the world of ISPs: {{champion:17}} I've read countless threads on Reddit, League forums and Whirlpool trying to find a fix, but it always seems to end with a TPG rep saying it's not their fault, blahblahblah /rant

replies.body:
TPG has a bad reputation with video games and playing them online.

So what that reddit post tells you to do is to redownload just about everything (which wouldn't fix your problems if they are connection issues, redownloading only fixes corruptions that 'Repair' cannot fix.) Then those other things, about how League isn't designed to run on operating systems better than Windows XP.

So, at the current moment, what happens after you launch League of Legends?
It crashes after a minute or so then shows the RADS error.

Ok, first make sure it's not a setting in your firewall/anti-virus preventing RADS from connecting. Then, try out the [temporary DNS change solution](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq4) (be sure to flush your DNS and reset your computer before trying.)

If that doesn't fix it, try [this](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq9).

If it's still not working, use [netalyzr](http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/) to analyse your connection, and post anything that appears in red/orange in the synopsis here.

Best of luck.
I can't view the first nor the second fix (can't access Riot servers at all); will post the result of neatlyzr soon.

>Changing to Public DNS

        >Open System Preferences
        Open the Network preference pane
        Select the active connection on the left, and click the "Advanced..." button in the lower right hand corner
        Click "DNS" from the selection bar.
        Remove any current DNS entries, and input the following public DNS servers:

    >8.8.8.8
    8.8.4.4

    >Save your changes by selecting "OK"
    Apply the changes by clicking "Apply" in the lower right hand corner

This is presuming you're on Windows. For Mac, go into your System Preferences> Network> Advanced...> DNS and do the same.

Then, flush your dns. Simple way to do that is to reset your computer.

That will set your DNS to Google's Public DNS. Do not stay on this if it doesn't work, as other internet services may be disabled. Remember your previous settings.

Best of luck.
I flushed my DNS and that seemed to fix the RADS issue however, I can't log in ("Login Error: The login server did not respond... /etc.)

That might be related to your TCP timestamps, but that only applies if you're on particular versions of Windows or on Linux.

heh

Ok, so have you been lagging at all before this started happening?

I've had no lag related issues before this. 

annnnnnnd the RADS issue is back. 
Going to try give TPG a call.

You're 100% sure that it's not a certain configuration in your firewall, or an anti-virus preventing RADS from connecting? The fact that it worked (at least, getting past the patcher) temporarily and then stopped again could mean that it wasn't working because another particular program/service was running on your computer.

You can also try clearing the cache of your browser and, if on Windows, resetting the settings of Internet Explorer and setting the security level to "Medium".

Also, try running the program in admin mode.

Do tell me what TPG has to say about this.
It's TPG 100 percent. I was with them for about 3 weeks of which nothing actually worked properly, A traceroute will also show you how screwed their hops are.

same I'm on netcomm i don't know if thats under something or whatever but this happened once before and i fixed it somehow but can't remember and all of the fixes aren't working for me now. I have been unable to redownload the game or lodge a support ticket because both websites are down for me now, this is kind of a joke i mean seriously
